div.em: Current conditions as of 29 Apr 07:56 am CDT

div.div: Partly sunny, with a high near 64. Breezy, with a north northwest wind 21 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 34 mph.
Mostly clear, with a low around 36. Northwest wind 12 to 17 mph decreasing to 5 to 10 mph after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 26 mph.
Sunny, with a high near 73. West northwest wind 5 to 7 mph becoming calm.

div.p:
Mustangs End Season in District Play
The Stanton Mustang boys basketball ended their season last Monday in sub-district play when they squared off against the Crofton Warriors. From the tip-off, it was a defensive battle throughout the first half. At the end of the first quarter the Mustangs and Warriors were tied at 6-6 and Stanton would take the second quarter 7-6 and a 13-12 lead going into halftime. “We felt very good . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Final Basketball article

h3.a: Scholstic Book Fair-Jungle: Elephants, tigers, and books, OH MY!

div.p:
Mark your calendar for the 2020 Book Fair, that will
be held March 2nd - March 5th at the Stanton Elementary School. The theme will be "Jungle: Elephants, Tigers, and Books, OH MY!
Hours:
Monday: 10:30A.M. -3:30P.M.
Tuesday: 10:30A.M.-1:30 P.M.
3:30P.M.-7:00 P.M. (PT Conferences)
Wednesday: 10:30A.M.-1:30P.M
3:30P.M.-7:00P.M. . . .

div.p:
Stanton Boys Win Regular Season Finale
The Stanton Boys Basketball team closed out it’s regular season, as they hosted Emerson-Hubbard last Friday night. The game would serve also as the final time seniors TJ Larson and Ben Wilke would suit up in front of their hometown crowd “We have had great leadership from TJ and Ben all season, the team was excited to for the opportunity to send them out with a victory”, . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Boys Basketball Win Season Finale

h3.a: JrHi Wrestling Kicks Season Off at Wisner

div.p: Monday January 20th was the first meet for the young Mustangs. They traveled to Wisner for an 11 team round robin tournament. The Mustangs placed third overall giving Coach Johnson and his wrestlers their first trophy of the season. Coach Robbie Johnson is in his first year as Head JrHi coach. High School/Youth coach Randy Hansen has been coaching these athletes through their Bronco wrestling days and can see the . . .

div.p:
Welcome to the Stanton Community Schools web page. I am very proud of the students & staff at our schools; we work hard everyday to challenge all to be their best. As the Superintendent of Schools, I welcome any feedback to make our school better for our students. Please feel free to e-mail me at msieh@esu8.org or by calling the school.
I have enclosed part of my resume for you to view so that you may know and understand me maybe a little better.
Sincerely
Michael J. Sieh
EDUCATION
University of . . .

div.h4: Click the Links Below to View Agendas
div.p:
Regular board meeting are scheduled for the second Monday of each month at the Stanton Community Schools' Middle/High School Library at 7:00 p.m. Some meeting may vary; however, the exact time, date and location is posted on each individual agenda.
